messages.subject: RE: [SHQ_Spy_Division] New fiction archive site
messages.msgSnippet: Never heard of them before, but their website exists: http://www.nFiction.com It looks to me like their kinda like fanfiction.net, only they just started. Heh.
messages.messageBody:
Never heard of them before, but their website exists:

http://www.nFiction.com

It looks to me like their kinda like fanfiction.net, only they just started.
Heh. Hardly have anything in their directories. :p

*shrugs* ^_^ I dunno how they found out about you though, I guess they sent
someone or something searching for authors and stuff.

On the internet...nothing is ever save or secure, no matter how much someone
claims your info stays private.


Miser Bellatrix

"Allow me to give you a hand...with your doom."


----------

Okay, so does anyone know anything about these people... and how did they
get my address (it's obviously computer-generated --- I don't write as
spiritus saitou)? This was in my bulk inbox this morning...

phil
>>#message v\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}#message o\:*
{behavior:url(#default#VML);}#message w\:*
{behavior:url(#default#VML);}#message .shape
{behavior:url(#default#VML);}#message st1\:*{behavior:url(#ieooui) }






Dear spiritus saitou ,





nFiction is the newest fanfiction site on the net and we would be proud to
feature your work through our site.



We have developed an easy-to-use interface so that you, the author will be
spending less time uploading stories and more time receiving reviews and
writing more of your fantastic work. Further more nFiction is a 100% free of
charge service.





---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ_Spy_Division] New fiction archive site
messages.msgSnippet: I got a message from them too a while back I registered and although it s like ff.net you can t seem to upload very long chapters or fics only part of a couple
messages.messageBody:
I got a message from them too a while back I registered and although
it's like ff.net you can't seem to upload very long chapters or fics
only part of a couple things came up correctly. Needless to say I
probably won't venture back there anytime soon.

--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ_Spy_Division] New fiction archive site
messages.msgSnippet: I just checked out the site (http://www.nfiction.net)... uh, it s almost completely patterned after ff.net --- unless they re connected to ff.net, I can hear
messages.messageBody:
I just checked out the site (http://www.nfiction.net)... uh, it's almost completely patterned after ff.net --- unless they're connected to ff.net, I can hear screams of "foul" unless they change their layout and graphics. I didn't go deeper and see what kind of rules they're forcing on authors, though.

I probably will not be archiving my stories there (or ff.net) because of my lack of control over format and presentation. I meant to make a proper announcement with a new story or something, but from now on I'm planning on keeping my fanfic on my own site --- http://philalexandros.tripod.com/wolf_in_the_coop . Someone is currently helping me set up a guestbook so any comments/reviews can be posted there.

I'll be curious to hear any comments about nfiction if anyone here explores it.

phil



---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?
Yahoo! Domains - Claim yours for only $14.70/year
